name: Inn and Spa at Loretto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four nights here in May 2013. Very clean and great service. But the location and restaurant could be the best in the city. Everything in walking distance, great pool area. Would stay again. It's a little pricey but sometimes they offer specials through living social. Room for improvement? Rooms need better lighting and some storage. Offer self parking not just valet.
reviews.title: Location and Restaurant make this place Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The beds at the Inn are to die for. The most comfortable in all of my travels. The padding, sheets, blankets, was heavenly. The drinks were fantastic in the bar area. The entertainment was stellar, wow, could that man sing! The ambience of the lobby and bar area is comfortable and southwestern. We loved our stay and would definitely stay here again. The concierge ladies are ditsy and have real attention and organization problems. Better to make your reservations on open table and skip that step or you will never get to your destination on time.
reviews.title: comfortable southwest style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just finished staying for 2 nights at the Inn and Spa at Loretto May 29th- 31st, 2013, suite 403, which was very nice. I'll tell about the room shortly. Upon arrival we were greeted by the excellent valet staff, we didn't have to handle any baggage up to our room, nor have any worry upon checkin. 5 stars for valet/bellmen. Always courteous, always professional and always a friendly smile and asking how everything was going. Checkin was equally easy. I will mention that parking is by valet only and we paid $19 per night.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We get up to our suite and loved it. Fireplace with firewood provided at no additional cost, comfortable leather sofa and loveseat, king size bed, a work table for us workaholics, complimentary wifi, mini bar(costly as others have pointed out) and TWO private balconies with tables and lounge chairs. The indian design of the room was awesome, toiletries were supplied in the bathroom such as soap, shower gel, shampoo and conditioner. The suite also included hair dryer, iron and ironing board, 2 robes to use and 2 sets of slippers. On the 4th floor is a deck with loungers for everyone to share. I would guess the room is approximately 500 sqft.
reviews.title: Dog Friendly Excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort has a small heated pool and hot tub, fitness center, spa, a very nice restaurant(the downside is there are so many places to eat in Santa Fe that is reasonably priced that the one awesome restaurant seemed overpriced. Complimentary computers and printer to use, there are 3 computers in the workstation room. There is also nice lounge area called the Living Room that has a bar.
reviews.title: A little precious and somewhat snooty...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I love the Southwest and were married in Albuquerque, NM in 1995. This was our 3rd trip to New Mexico and we decided to stay in Santa Fe. The hotel was beautiful, clean and centrally located so that it was easy to walk into downtown. The food is very good, although a bit pricey. The bar had a happy hour and it was fun to sit on the comfy sofas in front of the fireplace. I had a lavender scrub at the spa. The Loretto Chapel is attached to the hotel and is worth a tour. The history of the chapel is very moving.
reviews.title: Lovin Santa Fe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is great if you like interior cabins on bad cruise ships. Our room had only the light from the narrow balcony door and dim interior lamps. We shared our 4'x4' balcony with pigeons who left their droppings everywhere.These droppings were not removed by housekeeping during their daily visits so we did not use our balcony. The air conditioning was incredibly loud and obtrusive. Check out was lengthy, complicated and inaccurate. The food and the bar were fine.
reviews.title: Dark room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were at this hotel for a conference....great location! Our room, however, was just OK...we were at the very end of the property....and the elevator closest to us was "out of order"! Food service and bar service was very good. Breakfast in the hotel dining room was very good....as we're the drinks in the bar! This is a small hotel, which is nicely decorated!
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The property is in an excellent location, close enough to walk to the plaza and restaurants all around. The beds are to die for. The spa is the main reason we stay here, it is fabulous. The girls that work there are so nice and helpful. the spa area is beautiful!
reviews.title: Lovely property, excellent location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I had been traveling with my family for just under a month, we were on the road all day. I was done
reviews.title: We're here yeah!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made the Inn and Spa our destination for a long weekend trip to Santa Fe. We've walked by the property on our other visits to Santa Fe and finally decided to stay even though other hotels were less expensive. We checked in earlier than official hotel policy suggested but the front desk staff found a room for us and we settled in and began exploring the property and the area. Our room was comfortable and had a nice view of the chapel and the cathedral areas from our balcony. We spent part of an afternoon at the pool and were pleased with the beverage service and the ambience of their courtyard. Despite construction in the area and a busy city street next to the property, it was quiet and we had a peaceful night's rest. The location can't be beat and a short walk got us to any and all the attractions and shops we wanted to see. We're not spa fans but we were very pleased with the atmosphere and the customer service provided by the staff at this very nice property.
reviews.title: A Comfortable Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Very disappointed. When I arrived I was told one elevator was broken but would be fixed tomorrow. My room was furthest possible distance from elevator. Thought...ok...one day would not be a problem. The terrace was lovely, until night time when I realized chimney from restaurant grill was directly below me. So no using terrace and my room smelled like grilled meat (initially delicious...for first five minutes). When I complained, they sent a bottle of fabreeze.
reviews.title: Not worth $... Good location; that's it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Each day, I was told tomorrow the elevator would be fixed. By 8th day I was schlepping my luggage out for departure. Pretty place, poorly run.
reviews.title: Giacomo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool unheated. Staff was very friendly but uninformed. They didn't know basic things like shuttle schedule around Santa Fe. Restaurant is OUTSTANDING....but you don't have to stay here to eat here.
reviews.title: Great One Night Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights, a charming hotel in an excellent location.taxes and mandatory daily charges, i.e valet parking and housekeeper gratuity, adds approx 30 % to the advertised rate! Deluxe room was nicely furnished, but there was no dresser so you basically live out of your suitcase! Air conditioner is noisy and runs about once every 5 minutes, which is a problem if it's on during the night.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel for Santa Fe experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: had just booked for a week but enjoyed it enough to extend my stay.....even with a few glitches..the front desk did their best to make it up to us with credits and complimentary items....the main glitch was one elevator being out of order for too long a time however we were able to use the spa elevator which actually was even more convenient
reviews.title: would return to this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: food in luminaria some of the best we had eaten in santé fe....even the breakfasts were outstanding....very pleasant staff....the concierge crew absolutely bent over backwards to make our stay pleasant......lovely hotel....very centrally located so ease of access to activities , museums shopping etc was very good....the spa is unbelievable one of the best I have ever been in and the treatments were first rate..if I could have dragged my bed and sheets home with me I would have done so ....the most comfortable of any hotel I have ever stayed In in my lifeand really made for restful sleep. I did have one issue with the view of my room and was given several other options although I chose to stay there and was ultimately happy with that but was given a complimentary item that more than compensated for the issue...room was quiet and to wake up to the sound of a little bird on my balcony and the soft chimes of the cathedral bells was heaven.
reviews.title: Some Glitches But I Would Stay Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights. We are in our 50s but like to stay physically active so we are not in our rooms much. First the Pros: The location can't be beat. We only used our car for activities well away from downtown. Otherwise shopping, great restaurants, the museums are all within an easy, easy walk. Lorretto Chapel is literally next door. The downtown area is clean and safe so walking is the thing to do. The hotel lounge and bar area is very nice. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant so can't comment on that. The entire staff was friendly, professional and responsive and I have very high expectations in this area so I was very pleased with all of them from valet, to front desk. The hotel is very charming and appealing. Some have mentioned the rooms are dark. This was true for us as well but did not bother us as we weren't there much. We did like the decor. The room was very quiet we were in Room 210. There is a frig in the room so you can store your own stuff without paying the high price of hotel refreshments. My wife loved the Spa. The Cons: Most of the rooms seemed to have balconies but they are not very private with just waist high railing dividing them. That was especially true for us as our balcony was shared with the room next door (no railing) AND the table and chairs were directly in front of our sliding glass door as we had the view, not a good one but a little. This had an embarassing moment as our AC stopped working. I opened the sliding glass door and was cooling off in my boxers after a hot day horseback riding when the lady next door came and sat in the chair 2 feet away from me. Don't get Room 210 if the shared balcony would be a problem for you. The closet was in the bathroom and a bit small.The elevator was S-L-O-W so we used the steps unless moving luggage. The room rate was a bit high but I guess you're paying for location.
reviews.title: Not All That By Any Means

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We hope to come back to Santa Fe soon and would stay here again but would ask for a room with a better view and more private balcony if at all possible/available. One other thing you can be the judge of: Our AC did not work for 3 days. The first day I thought I was doing something wrong and then it took 2 days and 3 visits from maintenance. But they did try very, very hard to get it working ASAP and refunded me one night so you decide if this is a con or not.
reviews.title: Great beginning......checkout, not so much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed 2 nights here-I won a 2 night gift certificate. The gift certificate was supposed to have a value of $760, but we obviously got the cheapest (if you can even call their prices "cheap") room available. The bed was miserable, I had a backache for more than 2 days. The bathroom had tile that ran about 6" up the wall, and the ledge of the tile had THICK dusty dirt on it. The TV was NOT 42", it was 32", with a POOR selection of cable channels. The fruit basket you see in each room on the Loretto website was nowhere to be found in our room, and there were no little "extra" amenities.The "spa quality" shamppo/conditioner/lotion was comparable to dollar store quality. The hotel charges outrageous prices for everything in the room-a small can of Pringles chips, $5.00, a candy bar $5.00, bottled water, $5.00. We didn't bother to dine there, we found a wonderful Mexican place on Cerillos Road with delicious affordable food and wonderful service. The valets seemed annoyed each time they had to bring us our car, even though we tipped them well each time they brought the car for us.We live in Albuquerque, so the "thrill" of Santa Fe was nothing major for us, we wanted to get out and drive all over, not be tourists. In my opinion, there are much better places to stay- don't waste your money on this place.
reviews.title: Disappointing

aka: Inn And Spa At Loretto Hotel
description: An exquisite Santa Fe, New Mexico hotel reflecting the culture and sophistication of its historic setting, the Inn and Spa at Loretto features 134 guestrooms, a full-service spa, casual fine dining, art galleries and a tranquil garden. The Inn is ideally located in the heart of Santa Fe, near the Palace of the Governors and just one block from historic Santa Fe Plaza's galleries, museums, restaurants and boutiques. Effortlessly blending old-world charm with world-class splendor, this Santa Fe luxury hotel is one of the state's most photographed buildings. Built at the end of the historic Old Santa Fe Trail high in the spectacular Sangre de Cristo Mountains, the Inn and Spa at Loretto is an architectural recreation of the Taos Pueblo, a national historic landmark.
